title: nba.com scoreboard intermittently renders empty after Firefox has been running for some time;
content:
nba.com scoreboard intermittently renders empty after Firefox has been running for some time; issue persists across reloads, new tabs, private windows, containers, and site data clearing, and is resolved only by restarting Firefox.

When Firefox has been running for some time, opening nba.com results in the scoreboard section being completely empty. The rest of the page loads normally (layout, navigation, static content), but live game data does not render.

This issue does not occur immediately after a browser restart. It appears only after Firefox has been open and used for a while.

Once the issue appears, it becomes persistent and cannot be resolved without restarting Firefox.
creator: devmayh

title: Firefox won't go into background on Windows 11
content:
Hi, I'm on Firefox 147.0.3 and windows 11 business 25H2 (26200.7623), with two displays. For the past few weeks: - firefox stays on top - alt-tab to other window on that screen doesn't work, other app is not displayed over firefox - clicking on other app icon in task bar doesn't bring it to foreground/top - even other firefox window (like new private window) is opened in background - the only way around is to minimize firefox - without firefox opened, everything works normally It is really disturbing my flow / ways of interacting with apps / habit of using keyboard to move between apps.

Is it a bug, or is it a matter of some settings? I've seen similar quesiton from 9 years ago https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1140245 but there is no setting of the same name now?

title: The name/title of websites/tabs have shiftedto the left
content:
Today Firefox updated to 147.0.3 (aarch64). I work on MacOS Tahoe.

The titles on the very top of Firefox windows who used to be centered now have shifted to the left of the title bar, right next to the red-yellow-green buttons for close-hide-fullscreen.

I am almost blind in the left side so that is a real problem. I now have to turn my neck to find the NAME of a website/tab instead of just in front of me. Of course that worsens when I need a wide monitor (on pages with columns)

Where can I find the SETTING to return to the previous behaviour ? (as it's unimaginable that this change would not be an option to change)

Thanks in advance.
